alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:33PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Martin, northeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 433 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moree, or 11 miles east of Prestonsburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Threeforks, Piso and Coalpoint around 440 PM EDT. Laura, Varney and Pilgrim around 445 PM EDT. Conder, Heisey, Rural and Hatfield Station around 450 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Whitepost, Sidney, Canada, Forest Hills, Turkey Creek, Huddy, Aflex, Belfry, Hardy and Mcandrews. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 3 in Martin County between mile markers 2 and 4. U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 10 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
